author: Dylan Haar
title: Power Companies are seeing improvements in power outages after the ice storm
text:
Power Companies are seeing improvements in power outages after the ice storm
AYR, N.D., (KVRR)- A storm hit the region over Christmas, causing up to an inch of ice to accumulate in some areas. The ice downed miles of power lines and snapped countless utility poles. Power Crews have been working around the clock since Christmas to help bring back power back to the citizens impacted by the ice storm.
Around 480 Cass County Electric customers were still without power Wednesday morning. At one time, more than 4,600 members were affected.
Dakota Valley crews are also doing their best to return things to normal. Brandon Giesler, Manager of Engineering at Dakota Valley Electric Cooperative, said, ‚ÄúEverybody has been coming in at 7 in the morning and typically working until, you know, the start, it was prolly around 9 or 10 at night. And as its been going along, they‚Äôve been shutting down a little sooner.‚Äù
Giesler also said, ‚ÄúBut right now I believe we are down to one hundred and thirty some, i haven‚Äôt looked in the past hour or so but i believe that is where we are sitting right now.‚Äù
Dakota Valley initially had 3200 people without power. In just a week, Dakota Valley was impressed with the teamwork done to pull this off.
Giesler said, ‚ÄúBut the amount of progress these guys have been making is crazy. I thought it was going to take a little longer to get it to come to this point. But when you get that many people on the ground, it‚Äôs been coming together well.‚Äù
Dakota Valley Electric has had at least 100 people on the ground throughout the past week and expects the job to be finished soon.
Cass County Electric updated its power outage numbers tonight: they stand at 209 members.
The majority should be restored by the weekend.

author: CNN
title: Cher files for conservatorship of son Elijah Blue Allman over 'substance abuse issues' - 9Celebrity
text:
Cher has filed for temporary legal conservatorship of her adult son Elijah Blue Allman, citing his alleged ongoing substance abuse issues.
According to a petition filed this week in Los Angeles Superior Court and obtained by CNN, Cher is seeking to be the sole conservator of her son's estate, alleging that he "is currently unable to manage his assets due to severe mental health and substance abuse issues."
"Elijah is entitled to regular distributions from the Trust, but given his ongoing mental health and substance abuse issues," according to the documents.
Cher with her son Elijah Blue Allman in 2001. (Getty via CNN) "Petitioner [Cher] is concerned that any funds distributed to Elijah will be immediately spent on drugs, leaving Elijah with no assets to provide for himself and putting Elijah's life at risk."
The 47-year-old is the son of Cher and her former husband, the late rocker Gregg Allman.
Gregg Allman and Cher were married from 1975 to 1979. He died in 2017 at the age of 69 due to liver cancer complications.
The petition filed by Cher states that her son is set to receive funds from a trust by the end of the year. It also states that the 77-year-old singer and actress has "worked tirelessly to get Elijah into treatment and get him the help he needs."
"I'm not suffering from any problem that millions of people in the United States aren't," Cher once said of her son's substance abuse, (Getty) "Petitioner [Cher] loves Elijah immensely and has always acted with his best interests in mind," the filing states.
"I'm not suffering from any problem that millions of people in the United States aren't," Cher told People magazine in October, referring to her son's substance abuse.
"I'm a mother. This is my job ‚Äî one way or another, to try to help my children," she said.
"You do anything for your children. Whenever you can help them, you just do it because that's what being a mother is.
The biggest celebrity news story the year you were born View Gallery "But it's joy, even with heartache ‚Äî mostly, when you think of your children, you just smile and you love them, and you try to be there for them."
Cher is also the mother of Chaz Bono.
A hearing has been scheduled in March, according to court documents. CNN is working to determine if Allman has legal representation.
CNN has reached out to representatives for Cher for further comment.

author: CNN Newsource
title: What to know about the Supreme Court‚Äôs ruling allowing mifepristone to stay on the market
text:
By CNN staff (CNN) ‚Äî The Supreme Court unanimously rejected a lawsuit on Thursday challenging the Food and Drug Administration‚Äôs approach to regulating the abortion pill mifepristone, allowing the drug to stay on the market.The court ruled that the doctors and anti-abortion groups that had challenged access to the drug did not have standing to sue. Though technical, the court‚Äôs reasoning is important because it might encourage other mifepristone challenges in the future.Medication abortion accounts for nearly two-thirds of all US abortions , according to some estimates. The FDA approved mifepristone in 2000 as part of a two-drug regimen to end a pregnancy, and it has been shown to be safe and effective. The pill is also often prescribed for miscarriage treatment.Here‚Äôs what to know about the ruling: Plaintiffs had no standing The court ruled that the doctors and anti-abortion groups that had challenged access to the drug did not have standing to sue .Justice Brett Kavanaugh, who wrote the opinion, said the parties do not have standing ‚Äúsimply because others are allowed to engage in certain activities ‚Äî at least without the plaintiffs demonstrating how they would be injured by the government‚Äôs alleged under-regulation of others.‚ÄùData analyzed by CNN shows mifepristone ‚Äî the first drug in the medication abortion process ‚Äî is even safer than some common, low-risk prescription drugs, including penicillin and Viagra. Biden blames GOP for allowing challenge to abortion access President Joe Biden cast blame on Republicans for the very existence of the case, taking aim at GOP elected officials‚Äô ‚Äúextreme and dangerous agenda‚Äù on reproductive rights. Biden has worked to make protecting abortion rights a centerpiece of his reelection bid.Meantime, former President Donald Trump cautioned Republicans not to go too far on abortion in a meeting with the House GOP conference. The big picture Access to mifepristone has become particularly important after the court overturned Roe v. Wade two years ago and many states banned the procedure in clinical settings. The ruling is a significant setback for the anti-abortion movement.But the court‚Äôs technical reasoning is important because it might encourage other mifepristone challenges in the future. Much of the opinion covered the various legal thresholds a plaintiff must reach to make it appropriate for courts to intervene in a dispute.In addition, the Supreme Court is yet to release a decision on a case related to abortions in health emergencies. The justices will decide what happens when pregnant women show up to the hospital with medical emergencies in states that have strict bans on abortion . CNN‚Äôs Tierney Sneed and John Fritze contributed to this report. The-CNN-Wire

author: Yahoo!
title: Cold weather will set in this weekend for Sioux Falls; temperatures to hit negatives
text:
6 hours ago Sioux Falls is looking at freezing temperatures this weekend, according to the Sioux Falls National Weather Service (NWS). Temperatures are not expected to leave the teens or single digits entering next week, with lows dropping to -2 degrees and highs topping at 16 degrees, according to the NWS weekly forecast. author: thesun local
title: Multiple entry visa for Bangladeshi workers starts today in Malaysia
text:
PUTRAJAYA: The Multiple Entry Visa (MEV) facility for Bangladeshi workers officially takes effect today.
The Home Ministry confirmed the new measure applies to workers with valid Temporary Employment Visit Passes (PLKS) and Single Entry Visas (SEV).
No separate MEV application is required for eligible workers this year.
The Immigration Department will handle MEV issuance during PLKS renewals next year.
This system aims to improve oversight of foreign worker movements while reducing visa misuse risks.
The ministry expects the change to ease congestion at Malaysian embassies abroad.
The MEV facility underscores Malaysia‚Äôs commitment to ethical labour cooperation with Bangladesh.
It also aligns with efforts to protect foreign workers‚Äô rights under local and international laws. - Bernama

author: Faizan Hashmi
title: Romina Khurshid Lauds UK Support For Pakistans Climate Action - UrduPoint
text:
Faizan Hashmi Published July 19, 2024 | 02:50 PM
ISLAMABAD, (UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 19th Jul, 2024) Coordinator to the Prime Minister on Climate Change and Environmental Coordination Romina, Khurshid Alam lauded the UK 's support for Pakistan 's Climate action as the Ministry of Climate Change and Environmental Coordination and government of United Kingdom have agreed to enhance collaboration to address climate change and environmental issues in Pakistan .
The agreement was reached during a meeting between Coordinator to the Prime Minister on Climate Change, Romina Khurshid Alam, and a UK Embassy delegation met her led by Development Director, Jo Moire, on Friday, a news release said.
She said this collaboration marks a significant step forward in the fight against climate change, and both countries are committed to working together to address this global challenge.
Khurshid Alam stressed the importance of bridging civil society , academia, and corporate sectors in both nations to tackle the pressing issues of climate change and environmental degradation.
She highlighted the urgent need for tangible actions to mitigate global warming impacts, preemptively address flood risks, and support vulnerable farming communities.
The Coordinator noted that shifting weather patterns have significantly impacted agricultural productivity threatening food security and livelihoods with the country facing billions of Dollars in economic losses from climate-related disasters in the past.
The UK delegation presented a report to the Coordinator aimed at bolstering Pakistan 's climate resilience, and both sides agreed to work together to implement sustainable agricultural practices and mitigate future impacts.

organizations.name: ministry of climate change and environmental coordination

author: David Hern√°ndez
title: Detectan un peligroso malware en 14 apps de la Google Play con miles de descargas, revisa tu m√≥vil | Computer Hoy
text: Siempre es recomendable que echemos un vistazo a todas las aplicaciones que tengamos instaladas en nuestros dispositivos porque es probable que algunas de estas apps no las identifiquemos y puede que sean fraudulentas. Ahora, la firma de seguridad McAfee ha descubierto 14 aplicaciones infectadas en Google Play Store, y lo m√°s preocupante, es que tres de las cuales ten√≠an m√°s de 100.000 instalaciones cada una . Lo identifican como una puerta trasera de Android llamada Xamalicious y que ya habr√≠a infectado a 338.300 dispositivos a trav√©s de estas aplicaciones maliciosas. Aunque estas aplicaciones maliciosas ya se han eliminado de Google Play, llegaron a estar disponibles en alg√∫n momento, y es probable que te las instalaras. De esta forma, echa un vistazo a alguna de estas aplicaciones fraudulentas por si las tienes instaladas en tu dispositivo Android : Por otra parte, un conjunto separado de 12 aplicaciones maliciosas que llevan esta amenaza, se llegaron a distribuir en tiendas de aplicaciones de terceros a trav√©s de Archivos APK. La mayor√≠a de los dispositivos infectados se encuentran en Estados Unidos, Alemania, Espa√±a, Reino Unido, Australia, Brasil, M√©xico y Argentina. El malware despu√©s de su instalaci√≥n, se comunica con un servidor C2 y se activa si se cumplen ciertos requisitos previos espec√≠ficos como lo geogr√°ficos. De esta forma, este malware puede recopilar informaci√≥n del dispositivo y del hardware, puede determinar la ubicaci√≥n geogr√°fica del dispositivo, puede enumerar todas las aplicaciones del sistema instaladas en el dispositivo e incluso puede informar del estado de los permisos de los servicios de accesibilidad. Por otra parte, tambi√©n han descubierto, que Xamalicious tambi√©n es capaz de realizar fraude publicitario en los dispositivos infectados, provocando que el rendimiento de tu m√≥vil sea inferior al estar ocup√°ndose de realizar clics fraudulentos en segundo plano.

author: time news
title: Paris has experienced‚Ä¶ Zero hours of sunshine in the last five days
text:
Is the sun dead? Parisians have been able to legitimately ask themselves this question lately. Some may have even ‚Å£invested in a‚Å§ vitamin‚Å¢ D course as not a ray of sunshine touched the rooftops of the ‚Å£capital‚Äç for five consecutive‚Äå days, from Sunday 8 December to Thursday 12 December. We had ‚Äåto wait for this Friday to see the yellow‚Äã star timidly reappear in the sky.
‚ÄúA remarkable, but‚Å£ not extraordinary whether situation,‚Äù describes‚Äã the weather channel in a publication on six consecutive days of gray ‚Å¢ total exactly two years ago, from 1 to 6 December 2022.
‚òÅÔ∏èüå´Ô∏è‚òÅÔ∏è #Paris he just lived 5 days straight without the slightest‚Äå ray of #sunshine . A notable weather situation, but not exceptional.The capital experienced 6 consecutive days without sun ‚Å£from 1 to 6 December 2022. pic.twitter.com/44jbyHkZ0r
‚Äî La Cha√Æne M√©t√©o‚Å£ (@lachainemeteo) December 13, ‚Å£2024
These gloomy days are part ‚Å£of an already very dark period as, from December 1st‚Å£ to‚Äç 10th, Paris‚Äç recorded only 12 hours of sunshine in total, or just over an hour a day on average.
‚òÅÔ∏è‚Äã The northern half ‚Äçremains desperately trapped in gray weather‚Å§ this Wednesday. From November there‚Äã is very little sunshine in the northern half. HA‚Å§ #Paris there‚Å£ have been less than 12 hours of sunshine as the beginning of December. (Sat24 card) pic.twitter.com/YmAqG0Ke67
‚Äî Guillaume S√©chet (@Meteovilles) December 11, 2024
Be‚Å£ careful‚Äã not ‚Å¢to get used to the return of the sun too quickly. from this Saturday, the weather becomes more uncertain again during the day according‚Å£ to la Cha√Æne M√©t√©o, which already predicts ‚Äúvery‚Å¢ cloudy skies with brief sunny spells‚Äù.‚Å¢ ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a party in the clouds for this penultimate weekend before Christmas. In a general flow oriented towards the ‚Äånorth-west, humid‚Äç and‚Äå very ‚Å£cool air circulates over France‚Äù,‚Å§ explains the site.
And the same goes for‚Äã the following days,until next Thursday when some rays are expected.‚ÄúAs ofen ‚Å£happens ‚Å£at this ‚Å£time of ‚Å£year, humidity will be high ‚Å§in the lower layers‚Å¢ of the atmosphere,‚Äç which will result in numerous fogs and low‚Å£ clouds,‚Äù ‚Å§predicts La Cha√Æne M√©t√©o.You will have to‚Äã go to the‚Äå mountains or towards‚Å¢ the South-East to find the sun. ¬ª
How‚Å¢ can residents of Paris cope with extended periods ‚Å£of gray skies? Interview: Exploring the Sunless Skies of Paris
Interviewer : Welcome to ‚ÄãTime.news! today, we‚Äôre joined ‚Å¢by Dr. Elena Marceau, a climatologist and solar energy expert, to discuss a rather unusual phenomenon that has ‚Äåleft many Parisians wondering‚Äç if the sun has truly gone into hiding. Dr. Marceau, thank you for being hear.
Dr. marceau : Thank ‚Äãyou for having me! It‚Äôs ‚Å§great to be here, especially to discuss such an intriguing topic.
Interviewer : Indeed! so, let‚Äôs dive right in. Recently, Paris experienced five consecutive days ‚Äãwithout any sunlight. What caused this unusual weather pattern?
Dr.Marceau : This event was primarily due to a combination of seasonal weather factors, including persistent cloud cover and perhaps some atmospheric conditions ‚Äçthat trapped moisture in ‚Å¢the air. During‚Å£ December, especially in northern Europe, it‚Äôs not uncommon to see prolonged periods of gray skies.
Interviewer : It‚Äôs‚Å¢ fascinating to think‚Å§ about how weather can influence the daily lives of people in cities like Paris. How do‚Å§ you think this lack of sunlight affects the residents?
Dr.‚Å£ Marceau : the ‚Å§impact can be quite significant! Prolonged lack of sunlight‚Äå can lead to‚Å¢ mood changes and even Seasonal Affective Disorder ‚Äã(SAD) in some individuals. It‚Äôs not ‚Äçjust about feeling gloomy; the absence of sunlight can influence energy levels and ‚Äåoverall well-being. Some people may indeed be tempted to look into vitamin D supplements, as you mentioned earlier.
Interviewer : Speaking of‚Äã vitamin D, ‚Å¢how vital is sunlight for our health, especially during the ‚Äãwinter months?
dr. Marceau : Sunlight is ‚Äåcrucial for our bodies as it‚Å§ helps produce vitamin D, which is essential for bone health, immune function, and overall mood regulation. In winter months, especially in places with limited sunlight, ‚Äådietary sources or supplements become vital. It‚Äôs always good for people to be aware of their vitamin D levels, especially after ‚Å¢such long stretches of gloom.
Interviewer : That makes sense. Now, for those who turned to this unusual situation as a warning sign of climate change, what would you say? Is this event indicative‚Å§ of larger trends ‚Äãwe should‚Äã be concerned about?
Dr. Marceau : While isolated weather events can feel alarming,it‚Äôs important to differentiate between short-term weather patterns and long-term climate trends. This gray spell doesn‚Äôt directly indicate climate change on it‚Äôs‚Å¢ own. Though, it does highlight the urgency and importance of understanding how our climate is changing‚Å§ and how it might effect weather patterns in the future.
Interviewer : So, a single event shouldn‚Äôt lead to panic, but ‚Äãit‚Äôs still ‚Å¢a call‚Å¢ for awareness about our climate. As we wrap up, what can Parisians do to cope with these sunless days?
Dr.Marceau : Great question! People in Paris can embrace indoor activities that promote ‚Å¢well-being,such as yoga,reading,or cooking with friends. Light therapy lamps can also be helpful‚Äã for‚Å¢ those feeling a bit down. And, of course, getting any available sunlight whenever ‚Äãpossible is beneficial, whether through ‚Å§a walk or sitting by a window.
Interviewer : Thank you‚Å§ so much, Dr. Marceau! Today‚Äôs discussion sheds light on an frequently enough-overlooked aspect‚Äå of winter ‚Å¢living in urban areas. Here‚Äôs hoping for some sunny days ahead‚Äîor‚Å¢ at least a little vitamin D!
Dr. ‚ÄãMarceau : Thank you for having me! Let‚Äôs stay informed and keep looking up.
